00035 extern int oct_dev_handle;

00038 typedef enum {
00039     DATA8   =  1,
00040     DATA16  =  2,
00041     DATA32  =  4,
00042 /*    DATA64  =  8 */
00043 }  octeon_user_datatype_t;
00044 
00045 
00046 /** Opens the octeon device file and sets the handle.
00047  *  This needs to be done only once to communicate with all Octeon devices.
00048  *  @return  Success: 0; Failure: errno returned by open
00049  */
00050 int octeon_initialize();
00051 
00052 
00053 /** Closes the octeon device file. The user app cannot communicate with any
00054  * Octeon device after this step.
00055  *  @return 0
00056  */
00057 int octeon_shutdown();
00058 
00059 /** Do a Hot Reset of the octeon device. After a Hot reset, a new
00060  * application can be loaded on the octeon cores without having to
00061  * restart the octeon driver module.
00062  * @return 0 if the reset was successful.
00063  * @return errno has the reason if the reset failed.
00064  */
00065 int
00066 octeon_hot_reset(int oct_id);
00067 
00068 
00069 /** Get the number of octeon devices currently managed by the driver.
00070  *  @return Success: Count of Octeon devices.
00071  *  @return Failure: 0.
00072  */
00073 int octeon_get_dev_count();
00074 
00075 
00076 
00077 /** Send a request to Octeon. The request can be in UNORDERED or NORESPONSE
00078   * mode. For UNORDERED mode, both blocking (the function call blocks till
00079   * it gets a response from octeon) or non-blocking (the function returns
00080   * immediately). 
00081   * @param oct_id   - the octeon device to which the request is sent.
00082   * @param soft_req - the request in octeon_soft_request_t format.
00083   * @return  Success: 0; Failure: errno returned by ioctl
00084   */
00085 int octeon_send_request(int oct_id, octeon_soft_request_t  *soft_req);
00086 
00087 
00088 
00089 /** Query the status of a previously posted UNORDERED Non-blocking request.
00090   * @param oct_id - the octeon device to which the request is sent.
00091   * @param query  - query structure which holds the request id and in which
00092   *                 the status of the request is returned.
00093   * @return  Success: 0; Failure: errno returned by ioctl
00094   */
00095 int octeon_query_request(int oct_id, octeon_query_request_t  *query);
00096 
00097 
00098 int octeon_get_stats(int oct_id, oct_stats_t  *stats);
00099 
00100 
00101 
00102 
00103 /**  Read the Octeon PCI config register.
00104  *   @param oct_id - id of octeon device.
00105  *   @param offset - offset into the config space (register address).
00106  *   @param data   - address where the register contents (32-bit) are to copied.
00107  *   @return  Success: 0; Failure: errno returned by ioctl
00108  */
00109 int octeon_read_pcicfg_register(int oct_id, uint32_t offset, uint32_t *data);
00110 
00111 /**  Write to a Octeon PCI config register.
00112  *   @param oct_id  - id of octeon device.
00113  *   @param offset  - offset into the config space (register address).
00114  *   @param data    - 32-bit value to be written.
00115  *   @return  Success: 0; Failure: errno returned by ioctl
00116  */
00117 int octeon_write_pcicfg_register(int oct_id, uint32_t offset, uint32_t data);
00118 
00119 
00120 
00121 /**  Get the physical mapped address for different PCI address spaces.
00122  *   @param oct_id - the octeon device to get the mapping for.
00123  *   @param type   - the type of mapping ((BAR0, BAR1, BAR2)
00124  *   @param mapped_address - the mapped physical address is expected here.
00125  *   @param mapped_size    - size of the mapped region is expected here.
00126  *   @return Success: 0; Failure: errno if ioctl fails.
00127  */
00128 int octeon_get_mapping_info(int oct_id, octeon_reg_type_t type, 
00129                           unsigned long *mapped_address, uint32_t *mapped_size);
00130 
00131 
00132 /** Read a 32-bit value from a Octeon PCI mapped address.
00133  *  @param oct_id  - the octeon device to read.
00134  *  @param address - the address to read from.
00135  *  @param data    - Address where the 32-bit value should be read into.
00136  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: errno if ioctl fails.
00137  */
00138 int octeon_read32(int oct_id, unsigned long address, uint32_t *data);
00139 
00140 
00141 /** Write a 32-bit value from a Octeon PCI mapped address.
00142  *  @param oct_id  - the octeon device to write.
00143  *  @param address - the address to write to.
00144  *  @param data    - 32-bit value to write.
00145  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: errno if ioctl fails.
00146  */
00147 int octeon_write32(int oct_id, unsigned long address, uint32_t data);

00152 /** Read a 16-bit value from a Octeon PCI mapped address.
00153  *  @param oct_id  - the octeon device to read.
00154  *  @param address - the address to read from.
00155  *  @param data    - Address where the 16-bit value should be read into.
00156  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: errno if ioctl fails.

00158 int octeon_read16(int oct_id, unsigned long address, uint16_t *data);

00168 int octeon_write16(int oct_id, unsigned long address, uint16_t data);

00183 /** Write a 8-bit value from a Octeon PCI mapped address.
00184  *  @param oct_id  - the octeon device to write.
00185  *  @param address - the address to write to.
00186  *  @param data    - 8-bit value to write.
00187  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: errno if ioctl fails.
00188  */
00189 int octeon_write8(int oct_id, unsigned long address, uint8_t data);
00190 
00191 
00192 
00193 /** Write a 64-bit value to a 64-bit address in the Octeon PCI
00194  *  windowed access region.
00195  *  @param oct_id  - the octeon device to write.
00196  *  @param address - the address in the window to write to.
00197  *  @param data    - 64-bit value to write.
00198  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: errno if ioctl fails.
00199  */
00200 int octeon_win_write(int oct_id, uint64_t address, uint64_t data);
00201 
00202 
00203 
00204 /** Read a 64-bit value from a 64-bit address in the Octeon PCI
00205  *  windowed access region.
00206  *  @param oct_id  - the octeon device to read.
00207  *  @param address - the address in the window to read.
00208  *  @param data    - The 64-bit value read should be copied here.
00209  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: errno if ioctl fails.
00210  */
00211 int octeon_win_read(int oct_id, uint64_t address, uint64_t *data);
00212 
00213 
00214 
00215 
00216 
00217 /** Read "len" bytes from Octeon memory at address "core addr" and copy it into
00218  *  user-space memory at address "data". Use the byte-swap mode specified by
00219  *  "swap_mode".
00220  *  @param oct_id    - the octeon device to read.
00221  *  @param core_addr - the address in the Octeon memory to read.
00222  *  @param len       - number of bytes to read.
00223  *  @param data      - driver returns the data read from Octeon into user-space
00224  *                     starting at this address.
00225  *  @param swap_mode - byte-swap mode to use. Usually is 0 (no-swap)
00226  *                      or 1 (64-bit swap).
00227  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: errno if ioctl fails.
00228  */
00229 int octeon_read_core_direct(int oct_id, uint64_t core_addr, uint32_t len,
00230                             void *data, uint32_t swap_mode);
00231 
00232 
00233 
00234 
00235 /** Copy "len" bytes from user-space memory at address "data" into Octeon
00236  *  memory at address "core addr". Use the byte-swap mode specified by
00237  *  "swap_mode".
00238  *  @param oct_id    - the octeon device to write.
00239  *  @param core_addr - the address in the Octeon memory to write.
00240  *  @param len       - number of bytes to write.
00241  *  @param data      - driver copies data from this user-space address.
00242  *  @param swap_mode - byte-swap mode to use. Usually is 0 (no-swap)
00243  *                      or 1 (64-bit swap).
00244  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: errno if ioctl fails.
00245  */
00246 int octeon_write_core_direct(int oct_id, uint64_t core_addr, uint32_t len,
00247                              void *data, uint32_t swap_mode);
00248 
00249 
00250 
00251 
00252 
00253 /** Read 1/2/4 bytes from Octeon memory at address "address" and copy it into
00254  *  user-space memory at address "data". "datatype" specifies whether the
00255  *  read is 1/2/4 bytes wide.
00256  *  @param oct_id    - the octeon device to read.
00257  *  @param datatype  - specifies the number of bytes to read.
00258  *  @param address   - the address in the Octeon memory to read.
00259  *  @param data      - driver returns the data read from Octeon into user-space
00260  *                     starting at this address.
00261  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: errno if ioctl fails.
00262  */
00263 int octeon_read_core(int oct_id, octeon_user_datatype_t datatype,
00264                      uint64_t address, void *data);
00265 
00266 
00267 
00268 /** Copy 1/2/4 bytes from user-space memory at address "data" into Octeon
00269  *  memory at address "address". "datatype" specifies whether the
00270  *  read is 1/2/4 bytes wide.
00271  *  @param oct_id    - the octeon device to write.
00272  *  @param datatype  - specifies the number of bytes to write.
00273  *  @param address   - the address in the Octeon memory to write.
00274  *  @param data      - driver copies the data from this user-space address
00275  *                     into Octeon.
00276  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: errno if ioctl fails.
00277  */
00278 int octeon_write_core(int oct_id, octeon_user_datatype_t datatype,
00279                       uint64_t address, void *data);
